meanings.definition: Produce (books, newspapers, etc.) by a process involving the transfer of text or images to paper or another material.
meanings.sent1: I will print out the report for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She likes to print her essays in color.
meanings.sent3: The printer decided to print a joke on the last page.
meanings.sent4: His words were printed in my mind like a permanent marker.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the printing press filled the room with rhythm.

meanings.definition: A mark or indentation made by pressing something onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The dog left a muddy print on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate print of the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The print of the cat's paw looked like a tiny heart.
meanings.sent4: The print of the key was etched into the soft clay.
meanings.sent5: The print of the logo on the box was slightly smudged.

meanings.definition: A photograph or picture printed from a negative.
meanings.sent1: He framed the beautiful print of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: She bought a print of the famous painting for her wall.
meanings.sent3: The print of the family portrait brought back memories.
meanings.sent4: The print of the landscape was so vivid, it felt real.
meanings.sent5: The print of the old photograph was slightly faded but still precious.
